info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 14 at 1:39PM PDT until August 14 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HOT...DRY...WINDY...AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS TODAY FOLLOWED BY ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED THIS WEEK... .A very hot and dry air mass will produce low afternoon humidities, and when combined with afternoon and evening winds, critical fire weather conditions are expected for valleys west of the Cascades. Dry and unstable conditions could lead to rapid fire growth at the Flat Fire or any other active fires in the area. Additionally, monsoonal/tropical moisture will bring isolated to scattered thunderstorms through week. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR HAINES 6 WITH EXISTING FIRE FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 619... * IMPACTS...Dry and unstable conditions may lead to rapid fire growth on existing fires with plume dominated behavior possible. * AFFECTED AREA...In Oregon...Fire weather zone 619...including the Flat Fire and portions of the Rogue River-Siskiyou National Forest. * HAINES...6. * ADDITIONAL INFO...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Avoid tossing burning cigarettes on the ground, parking hot vehicles on dry vegetation, and using equipment that can cause sparks. Follow all fire restrictions. Find links to restrictions at weather.gov/medford/wildfire. One less spark, one less wildfire. Gather your fire evacuation kit now and familiarize yourself with your evacuation plan. Collect essentials you don`t want to lose and prioritize your checklist. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. These conditions promote rapid spread of fire which may become life threatening. Evacuate if ordered to, or if a fire threatens.
